article_title: Topsoil restoration requirement in Iowa could wash away
article_text:

article_metadata.news_keywords: , soil, landscape architecture, earth, iowa department of natural resources, lawn care, topsoil, water pollution, surface runoff, bettendorf, davenport, usd, steve grimes, iowa, joe griffin, iowa home builders association, stormwater coordinator, mike clarke, governor, public works director, terry branstad, director, environmental protection commission, caitlin russell, director of the bettendorf parks and recreation department, chemical fertilizers, clean water act, illinois environmental protection agency, illinois, brian schmidt, quad-city builders and remodelers association, state home builders association, bob buker, quad-city, ryan windmiller, project manager, the times, the trane co., mike richmond, brian stineman, natural resources manager, lucy hershberger, mcaninch corp., contractor, mark watkins, joe pietruszynski, stakeholders, home builders association of greater des moines, iowa city, andrew mason, public information officer

og.description: Change may be in store for an Iowa regulation that requires builders/developers in cities, including Davenport and Bettendorf, to restore the topsoil they scrape off during grading.
og.title: Topsoil restoration requirement in Iowa could wash away
